abstract: United Continental and Southwest forecast profitable 2015 due to less expensive jet fuel and strong travel, which send stocks soaring; United reports fourth-quarter profit of $28 million, down 80 percent from year-ago quarter; revenue fell 0.2 percent to $9.3 billion; Southwest's fourth-quarter profit was $190 million, down 10 percent from year-ago quarter; revenue was $4.6 billion, up 4.5 percent.
lead_paragraph: Share prices of both United and Southwest hit 52-week highs on Thursday, as the carriers predicted strong profits for the year.
snippet: Share prices of both United and Southwest hit 52-week highs on Thursday, as the carriers predicted strong profits for the year.

headline.main: Airlines Upbeat for 2015 as Oil Prices Fall and Demand Rises
headline.print_headline: Airlines Upbeat for 2015 as Oil Prices Fall and Demand Rises
